intro: Diplomorpha, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plants typically have dark green, waxy leaves that are heart-shaped or ovate in form. Diplomorpha species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their striking appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
